column4: How do I make ubuntu ask for the root password rather than the user's when I click on something like printer config?  Or even when I do a sudo command in the command line.
basically you have to sudo passwd root and then visudo
so /etc/sudoers IS the file I'm loking to edit?  Ok, that's where I looked first but saw nothing that struck me as the solution.
you have to tack rootpw somewhere
what do you mean?  I gave root a password
rootpw is a parameter - you did passwd root?
on the line with "Defaults" on it, add !rootpw at the end
I still get asked for my pass and not root's.  The line goes Defaults        !lecture,tty_tickets,!fqdn,!rootpw
it asks you for yours, but enter root's
but I want mine to stop working
I just installed jackd with my pass
hmm.... run sudo from the command line and see if you can enter ro0t's password
